sen.j: 金魚酒（きんぎょざけ）とは金魚が泳げるほど薄い酒の俗称。
sen.e: Kingyozake is a familiar name of sake which is so weak that a kingyo (goldfish) can swim in.

sen.j: 1937年に日中戦争が開戦され米不足のため酒の生産量が減少した。
sen.e: The Sino-Japanese war began in 1937, when the production volume of sake decreased due to rice deficit.

sen.j: 造り酒屋に対しても原料の米配給制度が実施される。
sen.e: The rationing system of rice, its material, was implemented also against sake breweries.

sen.j: 1943年の清酒清酒製造業整備要項により全国の半数の酒造所が戦時下の国策として強制的に廃業させられた。
sen.e: The half of the sake breweries nationwide were forced to go out of business by Sake Producing Equipment Instructions in 1943 as a national policy during the war time.

sen.j: さらに当時より酒造所は国税庁の厳しい管轄下にあり、造石税は出来上がった酒に加水すればするほど税金が安くなる仕組みであった。
sen.e: Furthermore, sake breweries were placed under the strict control of the National Tax Agency also in those days, and the tax on sake brewing had a system that more water the made sake was added by, the cheaper the tax became.

Furthermore, from that time, sake breweries were placed under the strict control of the National Tax Agency, and the tax on sake brewing had a system that more water added in the finished sake, the cheaper the tax became.

sen.j: 原料となる米不足、酒造所の廃業による清酒の生産量低下、そのため造り酒屋>問屋>小売店>消費者と流通過程で次々と加水された。
sen.e: The decrease of production volume of sake due to the deficit of rice as its material and closing of sake breweries caused the water-adding in sequence during the course of distribution; sake breweries, wholesalers, retailers, and consumers.
